collection.title: Allied Posters of World War I

items.title: The veteran's farewell
items.contributor: Dadd, Frank, 1851-1929, artist.; Straker Brothers, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 63.
items.description: A white-bearded veteran shakes the hand of a soldier in uniform. In the background, civilian recruits walk along behind a non-commissioned officer(?).
items.note: Signed "Frank Dadd." "Poster No. 63(?)." "W TW.16178" appears on bottom left of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Daddy, what did you do in the great war?
items.contributor: Johnson, Riddle & Co., printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 79.
items.description: Two children are by their fathers side. The little girl sitting on her dads lap, asks him what he did to help in the great war. The father looks confused as to what to tell her.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "Poster No. 79." Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Boys! come along
items.contributor: David Allen & Sons, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 80.
items.description: Illustration shows a shadowed figure of a serviceman saluting. Text says come along boys you are wanted.
items.note: "Poster No. 80." "W.417. 35M-4/15" appears on the bottom right of poster. Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: Why not join the army
items.contributor: Chorley & Pickersgill Ltd., printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 64.
items.description: A recruiting poster without pictorial content.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "Poster No. 64." Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: We're both needed to serve the guns!
items.contributor: Chorley & Pickersgill, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- Great Britain.
Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 85c.
items.description: Text says that both the serviceman and the worker are needed to serve the guns; so fill up the ranks, and pile up the munitions. Illustration shows a serviceman shaking hands with a worker.
items.note: Date based on dates if 1st World War. "Poster No. 85c." Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: Cold-blooded murder!
items.contributor: Roberts & Leete, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 97.
items.description: Text says to remember Germany's crowning infamy and cold blooded murder of women and children. Don't let these crimes against God and man make you afraid of the German barbarians but instead do something, enlist to-day. No pictorial content.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "Poster No. 97." "W.2464/446" appears on the bottom right of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: La victoire exposition
items.contributor: Galerie Devambez Imp., publisher, printer.
items.description: Text in French says that there will be a victory exposition to profit the National Committee of Physical and Sport Education and Social Hygiene. It will be March 11th to and including April 1st. Illustration shows an angel with wings susspended in air, symbolic of victory.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "Visa, No. 14.804." appears on the bottom right of poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Exposition de l'enfance
items.contributor: Schawdandjian, N., artist.; Etablissements Lecram, publisher.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- Red Cross.
items.description: Text in French says that the exposition for the children is organized by the American Red Cross, Bureau of the Children, for freedom. Illustration shows a child standing on his baby table, painting a bulletin board which tells of the exposition for the children.
items.note: Signed "N. Schawdandjian." "Visa No. 13.256." appears on the bottom right of poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Join the Canadian Grenadier Guards for overseas service
items.contributor: Montreal Lithographing Co., lithographer.
subjects: Canada -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc.
items.description: Text says to join the Canadian Grenadier Guards for overseas service. Illustration shows a Grenadier Guardsman.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Your country wants you
items.contributor: C. W. Faulkner & Co., printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 102.
items.description: Text says that your country wants you and 300,000 more men like you. Join now. No pictorial content.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "Poster No. 102." Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Ring it again
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.contributor: E. Ketterlinus & Co., printer.
items.description: Text says that the United States Liberty Loan is the safest investment in the world. Poster asks "Have you bought your bond?" Illustration shows the Liberty Bell.
items.note: Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Help your Red Cross
items.publisher: New York : Latham Litho & Ptg. Co.
items.contributor: Chapin, Hubert, artist.; Latham Litho & Ptg. Co., lithographer, printer.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- Red Cross.
items.description: Text says to please help the Red Cross. Illustration shows a church with a giant Jesus above and the Red Cross sign above him. A Red Cross nurse is seen helping a man step up from the earth.
items.note: Signed "Hubert Chapin." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Lend as they fight
items.contributor: Riesenberg, Sidney H., artist.; E. Ketterlinus & Co., printer.
items.description: Text says to buy more Liberty Bonds. Illustration shows two men fighting on the battlefield. One man is wounded.
items.note: Signed "Sidney H. Riesenberg." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Feed the guns with war bonds
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.contributor: Thomas, Bert, artist.
items.description: Text says to feed the guns with war bonds and help to end the war. Illustration shows three military men on the battlefield.  A long roll of National War Bonds seems to be rolling out of their gun.
items.note: Signed "Bert Thomas." "No. 113" appears on the bottom left of the poster. "4-315. WT 21738/2798. 10,000. 2/18. G.P.Ltd E3719" appears on the bottom right of the poster. Orientation:  Vertical.

items.title: Pour La France versez votre or
items.contributor: Faivre, Abel, 1867-1945, artist.; Société des amis des artistes, publisher.; Devambez (Firm), printer.
items.description: Text in French says to deposit your gold to help the war victory for France. Illustration shows a German soldier about to be crushed by a huge gold coin.
items.note: Signed "Abel Faivre." Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Prestito Nazionale
items.publisher: Bergamo : Officine Dell'Istituto Italiano D'Arti Grafiche
items.contributor: Borgoni, M., artist.; Officine Dell'Istituto Italiano D'Arti Grafiche, publisher.
items.description: Text in Italian tells of the need for a war loan. Illustration shows a man holding a flag and a sword.
items.note: Signed "M. Borgoni." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Share in the victory
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.contributor: Coffin, Haskell, artist.
items.description: Text says to share in the victory and save the country by buying war savings stamps. Illustration shows a symbolic womens figure with wings holding a sword in one hand and a branch leaf in the other.
items.note: Date based on America's participation in the war. Signed "Haskell Coffin." "WS-A2" appears on the bottom left of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Tired of giving?
items.contributor: Darling, Jay N. (Jay Norwood), 1876-1962, artist.; American Women's Hospitals, publisher.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- United States.
items.description: Text says you should not be tired of giving because you don't know what it really is to be tired, so give and help these people. Illustration shows a women and child sitting among the ruins.
items.note: Signed "J.N. Ding." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Order coal now
items.contributor: Leyendecker, J. C., 1874-1951, artist.; United States. Fuel Administration, publisher.; Edwards & Deutsch Litho. Co., lithographer.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- United States.
items.description: Text says to order coal now. Illustration shows a man on a horse and wagon.
items.note: Signed  "J.C. Leyendecker." Date based on America's participation in the war. "No. 2," appears on the bottom left of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Enlisted for duration of the war
items.contributor: Praill, R. G., artist.; Avenue Press, publisher.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- Great Britain.
World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- Great Britain.
items.description: Text says to help the national egg collection for the wounded. Illustration shows a hen.
items.note: Signed "R.G. Praill." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Ligue Maritime Française
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.contributor: Fouqueray, Charles, 1869-1956, artist.
items.description: Text if French tells of the French Maritime League. Illustration shows men working on a ship.
items.note: Signed "D. Charles Fouqueray." "Visa No. 14375" appears on bottom of poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: "The spirit of woman-power"
items.publisher: [Washington, D.C.] : Woman's Committee of Council of National Defense
items.contributor: Honoré, Paul, 1885-1956, artist.; Niagara Litho. Co., lithographer.; United States. Woman's Committee of Council of National Defense.
items.description: Text encourages women to register to serve their country however they can. Illustration shows a woman playing the drums as she leads other women on a march.
items.note: Signed "Paul Honoré." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Wanted 25000 student nurses
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : Woman's Committee of the Council of National Defense John H. Eggers Company.
items.contributor: Bancroft, Milton, artist.; John H. Eggers Company, printer.; Council of National Defense. Woman's Committee, publisher.
subjects: World War, 1914-1918 -- War work -- United States.
items.description: Text says that student nurses are needed in the U.S. Student Nurse Reserve. Illustration is a drawing of a nurse.
items.note: Signed "Milton Bancroft." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: For food production forage & timber
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : J.W. Ltd.
items.contributor: J. W. Ltd., printer.
subjects: World War,1914-1918 -- War work -- Great Britain.
items.description: Text says that recruits are required immediately for the Women's Land Army so enrol today. Illustration shows a women with a cow, holding a bucket.
items.note: "M 106 B2919 W1-24760/205 50 M 4/18" appears on bottom left of poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Mother's Day : August 8
items.publisher: London : Vincent Brooks Day & Son Ltd.
items.contributor: Cofpin, E., artist.; Vincent Brooks Day & Son, lithographer.
items.description: Text says Mother's Day is August 8th. Do not forget. Illustration shows a women reading a letter from her son. The photograph of a uniformed military man is on the table near her. The top of poster shows a military man running with his weapon.
items.note: Signed "E. Cofpin." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Save the products of the land
items.contributor: Bull, Charles Livingston, 1874-1932, artist.; United States Food Administration, publisher.; Heywood Strasser & Voigt Litho Co, lithographer.
items.description: Text says to save the products of the land by eating more fish because they feed themselves. Illustration shows fish in the water.
items.note: Signed "Charles Livingston Bull." Date based on America's participation in the war. "No. 13" appears on the bottom left of the poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Uncle Sam needs that extra Shovelful
items.contributor: Sindelar, F., artist.; United States. Fuel Administration, publisher.; Latham Litho & Ptg. Co., lithographer.
items.description: Text says that Uncle Sam needs that extra shovelful of coal to preserve a soldier's life. So save the coal. Illustration shows Uncle Sam standing behind a man shoveling the coal into the furnace.
items.note: Signed  "F. Sindelar." Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Sugar means ships
items.contributor: Judson, E., artist.; United States Food Administration, publisher.; Carey Printing Company, printing.
items.description: Text says that the consumption of sugar sweetened drinks must be reduced, because the ships which would deliver the sugar for the drinks are needed to carry soldier's and supplies. Illustration shows a women drinking with a straw as a bunch of tiny ships marked "sugar"  go in her direction while other little ships marked "supplies" and "soldiers" go in the direction of the "war."
items.note: Signed "E. Judson" (?) Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Horizontal

items.title: Eat no eggs in Easter week
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.description: Text says to give eggs to the wounded during Easter week. Illustration shows a man on crutches pointing to a calender which is marked off on dates in April which are Easter week.
items.note: Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: British Empire Union
items.contributor: Wilson, David, artist.; British Empire Union, publisher.; Globe Printing Co., printer.
items.description: Text says to remember that Germans are not to be trusted. Once a German, always a German! Every German employed means that a British worker would be idle. Illustrations show five different depictions of German men being barbarian in the war. One depiction shows a German man dressed in a suit, tipping his hat to be polite, with the words "1914-1918, Never again!"
items.note: Signed "David Wilson" + "WFB." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Save your child
items.description: A poster for the Third Liberty Loan campaign.  The text says "Save your child from German barbarism" by huying government bonds. The illustration shows a dead woman with two young children dead next to her.
items.note: Date of issue based on the date of the Third Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: Souvenez-vous de la Belgique
items.contributor: David Allen & Sons, printer, publisher.
items.description: Text in French says to remember Belgium and the north of France. Poster also says to not buy anything German. Illustration shows a German soldier stepping on the body of a Belgian women and her infant.
items.note: Date based on dates of 1st World War. "No. 0198" appears on the bottom left of the illustration. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Remember the Lusitania
items.contributor: David Allen & Sons, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.
subjects: Great Britain -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc. -- World War, 1914-1918.
items.series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 90.
items.description: Text says to remember The Lusitania, which was attacked and sunk by the Germans. It is important to enlist to-day. No pictorial content.
items.note: "Poster No. 90" appears on the bottom right of the poster. "5M-5/15" appears on the bottom right of the poster. Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: America calls
items.publisher: New York : U.S. Navy Publicity Bureau
items.contributor: Leyendecker, J. C., 1874-1951, artist.; United States. Navy Publicity Bureau, printer.; Beck Engraving Co., engraver.
items.description: Text says that America calls you to enlist in the Navy. Illustration shows a sailor shaking the hand of the Statue of Liberty.
items.note: Signed "J.C. Leyendecker." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: Remember!
items.publisher: Place of publication not identified : publisher not identified
items.contributor: Oakley, H. L., artist.; Chorley & Pickersgill, printer.
items.description: A recruiting poster. Text says that if your between 15 1/2 and 40, join the navy. Illustration shows shadow figures of navy men.
items.note: Signed "H.L. Oakley." Date based on dates of 1st World War. Orientation: Horizontal.

items.title: Journée des régions libérées
items.contributor: Steinlen, Théophile Alexandre, 1859-1923, artist.; Lapina, printer.
items.description: Text in French tells of a day for the liberated regions to benefit and give aid to the sad brothers. Illustrations shows a cross gravestone with a bird sitting on the top.
items.note: Signed "Steinlen." "Visa No. 16.488" appears on the left border of poster. Orientation: Vertical.

items.title: L'Alarme
items.contributor: Léandre, Charles, 1862-1934, artist.; Devambez (Firm), printer.
items.description: Text in French tells of all the dangers of alcoholism. The poster tells people to stop drinking alcohol. Illustration shows a family with four children who are in very bad, and neglected condition and appear to be suffering.
items.note: Signed "C. Léandre."  Orientation: Vertical.
